heading: The highest denomination currency note in India is...
content: No, Rs. 2000 is not the highest denomination currency note in Indian history - it was Rs. 10,000!

heading: Did you know?
content: More monopoly money is printed in the US than the real cash!

heading: Did you know?
content: The rupee is known by different names depending on the area of the country: we can hear people calling it upaya, roopayi, rubai or ropa.

heading: Did you know?
content: 1,000 rupees, 5,000 rupees and 10,000 rupees notes were reintroduced in 1954 and demonetized in 1978.

heading: Indian currency notes aren't made from regular paper.
content: They are made from a pulp that contains cotton, balsam, special dyes, and gelatin or polyvinyl alcohol.

heading: Did you know?
content: 15 out of the official 22 languages appear on Indian currency notes.

heading: Did you know?
content: In 2007, a shortage of coins in Kolkata led shopkeepers to buy them at more than their face value.

heading: Did you know?
content: Each coin has a unique shape right below the year that helps identify which city it was minted in.

heading: Did you know?
content: Pound sterling is world's oldest currency still in use.

heading: Mind your business.
content: Yes, that was the motto of the first US coin!

heading: Did you know?
content: The first person convicted of speeding was going eight mph.

heading: Did you know?
content: The world wastes about 1 billion metric tons of food each year!

heading: It's illegal to own just one guinea pig in Switzerland.
content: It's considered animal abuse because they're social beings and get lonely.

heading: People are more creative in the shower.
content: When we take a warm shower, we experience an increased dopamine flow that makes us more creative.

heading: Jennifer Lopez inspired Google images?
content: So many people were searching for the outfit she wore at the 2000 Grammys, that they added the feature.

heading: Pigeons can tell the difference between Picasso and Monet.
content: What?! A 1995 study shows that the birds can differentiate between the two artists.

heading: The real name for a hashtag is an octothorpe.
content: The 'octo' refers to the eight points in the symbol, but according to the Merriam-Webster dictionary the 'thorpe' part is a mystery.

heading: Did you know?
content: You can hear a blue whale's heartbeat from over 2 miles away.

heading: Did you know?
content: Octopuses have three hearts.

heading: Did you know?
content: The platypus doesn't have a stomach at all: Their esophagus goes straight to their intestines.

heading: Did you know?
content: Polar bears have black skin. And actually, their fur isn't white—it's see-through, so it appears white as it reflects light.

heading: Did you know?
content: Mosquitoes are the deadliest animal in the world: They kill more people than any other creature, due to the diseases they carry.

heading: Did you know?
content: Walmart has a lower acceptance rate than Harvard.

heading: China censored the word for 'censorship.'
content: I guess you can't be guilty of a crime if nobody can describe what it is!

heading: Did you know?
content: You're twice as likely to be killed by a vending machine than a shark, according to the New England Aquarium.

heading: Did you know?
content: Britain's Secret Intelligence Service once hacked an Al-Qaeda website and replaced the bomb instructions with a cupcake recipe.

heading: Did you know?
content: Monowi, Nebraska, is a town in the United States with an official population of one person. Yes, she owes taxes… To herself!

heading: Did you know?
content: Some cats are actually allergic to humans.

heading: Did you know?
content: High heels were originally worn by men.

heading: New York was briefly named 'New Orange.'
content: Yes, before it was the Big Apple, it was New Orange.

heading: Ever heard about moonquakes?
content: Though less common than earthquakes, the moon actually has moonquakes, too. That's right. Moonquakes.

heading: Hate the in-flight meals?
content: It's because you actually lose a large percentage of your taste buds while in an airplane.

heading: Did you know?
content: The most expensive film ever made was Pirates of the Caribbean, which cost more than 375 million dollars to create.

heading: Did you know?
content: Russia has a whopping 11 time zones within the country.

heading: Here's something fun for you.
content: Believe it or not, wombats' poop is cube-shaped.

heading: A little gross, but also kind of funny.
content: Lobsters pee out of their faces.

heading: Did you know?
content: Whether you realize it or not, you blink around 20 times per minute.

heading: Did you know?
content: There are more than 200 languages that have been invented just for television or movies.
